#ReleaseTheReport

My condolences to his wife Kitty, his son Evan, and his whole family.

text:

I’m challenging @SenateGOP to agree to these 3 principles:

1. Climate change is real
2. It's caused by humans
3. Congress needs to acthttps://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1lDGLMMwVPzJm …

html: Dear @SenateMajLdr McConnell: Stop trying to distract from the fact that the GOP has no plan on climate change. I'm headed to the Senate Floor to issue you a challenge to admit for the first time: 1. Climate change is real 2. It's caused by humans 3. Congress needs to act
text:
Dear @SenateMajLdr McConnell:
 
Stop trying to distract from the fact that the GOP has no plan on climate change.

I'm headed to the Senate Floor to issue you a challenge to admit for the first time:

1. Climate change is real
2. It's caused by humans
3. Congress needs to act

html: I just spoke to @FreedomForumIns. Here's what I said: A #FreePress has always kept government in check We rely on a free press to: Inform Shine light on injustice Establish fact Hold elected officials like me accountable A free press is how we discern democracy from autocracypic.twitter.com/y0lBZGy27M
text:
I just spoke to @FreedomForumIns. Here's what I said:

A #FreePress has always kept government in check

We rely on a free press to:
Inform
Shine light on injustice
Establish fact
Hold elected officials like me accountable

A free press is how we discern democracy from autocracypic.twitter.com/y0lBZGy27M

html: Saddened to hear of the passing of Frank Robinson. He was one of the greatest ball players of my lifetime—an elite Hall of Famer. The 1st African American manager in @MLB history, he fulfilled Jackie Robinson’s dream, and earned a place in the history of American civil rights.
text:
Saddened to hear of the passing of Frank Robinson.

He was one of the greatest ball players of my lifetime—an elite Hall of Famer.

The 1st African American manager in @MLB history, he fulfilled Jackie Robinson’s dream, and earned a place in the history of American civil rights.

If President Trump won’t re-open government, we have to protect the workers he is leaving without a paycheck.

text:
First, Republicans tried to eliminate the ACA in Congress and failed, so they turned to the courts. 

Because the legal reasoning is so faulty, hopefully the ruling will not stand. 

But what will stand is Republican ownership of such a harmful and disastrous lawsuit.

html: Farr appealed to the United States Supreme Court which also rejected his arguments and affirmed the District Court’s ruling.http://www.scotusblog.com/case-files/cases/mccrory-v-harris/ …
text: Farr appealed to the United States Supreme Court which also rejected his arguments and affirmed the District Court’s ruling.http://www.scotusblog.com/case-files/cases/mccrory-v-harris/ …

html: The court held that “race predominated in both” congressional districts and that the 2011 redistricting “affected North Carolina citizens' fundamental right to vote, in violation of the Equal Protection Clause.”https://www.leagle.com/decision/infdco20160208846 …
text: The court held that “race predominated in both” congressional districts and that the 2011 redistricting “affected North Carolina citizens' fundamental right to vote, in violation of the Equal Protection Clause.”https://www.leagle.com/decision/infdco20160208846 …

html: Farr argued that plaintiffs had “failed to demonstrate that race was the ‘predominant factor’ used by the General Assembly in drawing” the two congressional districts. A U.S. District Court rejected Farr’s arguments.
text: Farr argued that plaintiffs had “failed to demonstrate that race was the ‘predominant factor’ used by the General Assembly in drawing” the two congressional districts. A U.S. District Court rejected Farr’s arguments.

html: In Harris v. McCrory, yet another challenge to NC’s 2011 redistricting plan, the plaintiffs alleged that the NC legislature violated the 14th Amendment when it used race as the predominant consideration with respect to two congressional districts redrawn after the 2010 census.
text: In Harris v. McCrory, yet another challenge to NC’s 2011 redistricting plan, the plaintiffs alleged that the NC legislature violated the 14th Amendment when it used race as the predominant consideration with respect to two congressional districts redrawn after the 2010 census.

html: Although the NC Supreme Court agreed with Farr, the U.S. Supreme Court ultimately vacated the state court’s judgment. They remanded the decision in light of Harris v. McCrory/Cooper v. Harris. What did this decision say?
text: Although the NC Supreme Court agreed with Farr, the U.S. Supreme Court ultimately vacated the state court’s judgment. They remanded the decision in light of Harris v. McCrory/Cooper v. Harris. What did this decision say?

html: In his arguments, Farr dismissed the challenges as politically motivated and argued that NC had a compelling interest “in preemptively factoring race into its redistricting process” to avoid liability under the Voting Rights Act.
text: In his arguments, Farr dismissed the challenges as politically motivated and argued that NC had a compelling interest “in preemptively factoring race into its redistricting process” to avoid liability under the Voting Rights Act.

html: In 2014, Farr represented NC in Dickson v. Rucho, a case in which both the legislative and the congressional plans in the state’s 2011 redistricting were challenged as impermissible racial gerrymanders.
text: In 2014, Farr represented NC in Dickson v. Rucho, a case in which both the legislative and the congressional plans in the state’s 2011 redistricting were challenged as impermissible racial gerrymanders.

html: In their rejection, the court held the districts unconstitutional, citing “copious statewide evidence” that “race was the predominant criterion in drawing all of the challenged districts.” The decision was later affirmed by the Supreme Court. https://www.brennancenter.org/sites/default/files/legal-work/Covington_PerCuriamOpinion_06.05.17.pdf …
text: In their rejection, the court held the districts unconstitutional, citing “copious statewide evidence” that “race was the predominant criterion in drawing all of the challenged districts.” The decision was later affirmed by the Supreme Court. https://www.brennancenter.org/sites/default/files/legal-work/Covington_PerCuriamOpinion_06.05.17.pdf …

html: In Covington v. NC, Farr argued that race was not the primary factor used in the redistricting. And even if it was, Farr argued the NC legislature’s use of race was reasonably necessary to comply with the Voting Rights Act. The trial court rejected this argument.
text: In Covington v. NC, Farr argued that race was not the primary factor used in the redistricting. And even if it was, Farr argued the NC legislature’s use of race was reasonably necessary to comply with the Voting Rights Act. The trial court rejected this argument.

html: In 2016-17, Farr represented NC in Covington v. NC, a challenge to the state’s 2011 legislative redistricting alleging each of NC’s 19 state House districts & 9 state Senate districts constituted a racial gerrymander violating the Equal Protection Clause.https://www.brennancenter.org/legal-work/north-carolina-v-covington …

html: What we know about President Trump’s Health Care agenda: He supports letting employers impose lifetime & annual limits on critical types of health care. That means coverage could be cut off just when you get sick & need it most. But isn’t that the whole point of health care?
text:
What we know about President Trump’s Health Care agenda: 

He supports letting employers impose lifetime & annual limits on critical types of health care. That means coverage could be cut off just when you get sick & need it most. 

But isn’t that the whole point of health care?

html: But, we still have more work to do. That’s why I’m fighting hard for a long term re-authorization of the National Flood Insurance Program with reforms to better provide homeowners with flood protection for a stable and fair cost.
